availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harvey J. Willis (Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Owen Willis and Lurana Willis. Married to Artimetia M. Willis. Father of Robert O. Willis, Isaac H. Willis, Mary L. Willis, H. H. Willis, John D. Willis, and B. I. Willis. Resident of Grayson County in 1850. Farmer in Grayson County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 26. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Litchfield, p. 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Litchfield, p. 8. Find A Grave, "Harvey Jiles Willis, Sr. (1820-1904)," Memorial #45305189, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=45305189&ref=acom (accessed June 23, 2017).
